comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text:
I need this for bug 669190.  I want to be able to force on ES5 strict mode for the following APIs:

  JS_CompileUCFunctionForPrincipalsVersion
  JS_EvaluateUCScriptForPrincipalsVersion
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text:
I need this for bug 669190.  I want to be able to force on ES5 strict mode for the following APIs:

  JS_CompileUCFunctionForPrincipalsVersion
  JS_EvaluateUCScriptForPrincipalsVersion
Blair, how badly do you need this and when?
comments.creator: dmandelin@mozilla.com
comments.text: Blair, how badly do you need this and when?
comments.author: dmandelin@mozilla.com

comments.raw_text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Blair, how badly do you need this and when?

Not terribly badly, and it's not needed right away. It's certainly not blocking any feature. We'd like to convert more of the browser frontend to use strict mode - so we definitely want it, but in the mean time doing non-XBL code gets us part of the way.
comments.creator: blair@theunfocused.net
comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Blair, how badly do you need this and when?

Not terribly badly, and it's not needed right away. It's certainly not blocking any feature. We'd like to convert more of the browser frontend to use strict mode - so we definitely want it, but in the mean time doing non-XBL code gets us part of the way.
comments.author: blair@theunfocused.net

comments.raw_text: You could call JS_SetOptions(cx, JS_GetOptions() | JSOPTION_STRICT_MODE) before compiling and reverse it afterwards.
comments.author: benjamin@locrian.net
comments.text: You could call JS_SetOptions(cx, JS_GetOptions() | JSOPTION_STRICT_MODE) before compiling and reverse it afterwards.
comments.creator: benjamin@locrian.net
benjamin@locrian.net
comments.text: It would now be trivial to add this using the new C++ compile options api.
comments.author: benjamin@locrian.net
comments.raw_text: It would now be trivial to add this using the new C++ compile options api.
